intro: Becium choanum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, which helps it conserve water. Becium choanum is often found in shrubland and coastal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
